intro: Sida dictyocarpa, commonly known as the woolly mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed areas and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida dictyocarpa is known for its ecological importance as a source of nectar for pollinators.
